item.title: Functional Programming
item.description: The main idea of functional programming is to organize the code around the use of functions. Each function should perform only one clearly defined task and needs to be pure.

item.title: Object Oriented Programming
item.description: Object Oriented Programming (OOP) is a [[notes/python/Programming Paradigm]]

item.title: Procedural Programming
item.description: Procedural Programming is a [[notes/python/Programming Paradigm|Programming Paradigm]]. The idea is to get things done in a sequence of steps i.e think of the code as a step-by-steo course of action that needs to be executed.
